text.p: Consider the list of vectors [mathjaxinline]\{ v_1; v_2\}[/mathjaxinline], where [mathjaxinline]v_1[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]v_2[/mathjaxinline] are vectors in [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline] as given in this picture:

Can you find scalars [mathjaxinline]a_1, a_2[/mathjaxinline], not both zero, such that [mathjaxinline]a_1v_1 + a_2 v_2 = \mathbf{0}[/mathjaxinline]? If so, enter an example of such scalars below. If not, enter ‘No'.
Is the list [mathjaxinline]\{ v_1; v_2\}[/mathjaxinline] linearly dependent or linearly independent?
